SEARCH
Package FinalProject

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
FinalProject.Ship
Direct Known Subclasses:
Battleship, Cruiser, Destroyer, EmptySea, Submarine
public abstract class Ship extends Object
This is the abstract Ship class, which acts as the parent class for all individual types of ships

      public boolean isHorizontal()
      Get the orientation of the ship
      Returns:
      true if the ship is placed horizontally; false if vertically.

    • setHorizontal

      public void setHorizontal(boolean horizontal)
      Set the orientation of the bow
      Parameters:
      horizontal - boolean indicates whether the ship is positioned horizontally or not

    • getShipType

      public abstract String getShipType()
      Return the type of the ship. Each type of Ship (e.g. Destroyer, Cruiser, etc.) needs to override and implement this method and return its respective ship type as a String.
      Returns:
      the String which indicates the type of the ship

    • okToPlaceShipAt

      public boolean okToPlaceShipAt(int row, int column, boolean horizontal, Ocean ocean)
      Determines whether it is permissible to place a ship of the specified length with its bow at the given row, column, and orientation.
      Parameters:
      row - The row where the ship is to be placed (int)
      column - The column where the ship is to be placed (int)
      horizontal - Indicates the ship's orientation (boolean)
      ocean - The ocean in which the ship is to be placed.
      Returns:
      true if placing a ship of this length with its bow in this location is acceptable; otherwise, false

    • okInitialPoint

      public boolean okInitialPoint(int row, int column, boolean horizontal)
      Checks if the given point (row, column) is suitable for placing a ship of the specified length in the indicated orientation (horizontal or vertical) within the 10x10 grid.
      Parameters:
      row - The starting row for the ship placement (int).
      column - The starting column for the ship placement (int).
      horizontal - A boolean indicating whether the ship is to be placed horizontally or vertically.
      Returns:
      true if the point allows for the placement of the ship; otherwise, false.

    • pointOk

      public boolean pointOk(int row, int column)
      Checks if the specified grid coordinates (row, column) are within the valid range of a 10x10 grid.
      Parameters:
      row - The row number (int).
      column - The column number (int).
      Returns:
      true if the grid coordinates are within the valid range; otherwise, false.

    • placeShipAt

      public void placeShipAt(int row, int column, boolean horizontal, Ocean ocean)
      Places the ship in the ocean by referencing it in one or more locations (up to 4) within the ships array in the Ocean object.
      Parameters:
      row - Starting row of the ship (int).
      column - Starting column of the ship (int)
      horizontal - Indicates whether the ship is to be placed horizontally (boolean)
      ocean - The Ocean object in which the ship is to be placed

    • shootAt

      public boolean shootAt(int row, int column)
      If a part of the ship is located at the specified row and column, and the ship has not been sunk, mark that part of the ship as "hit."
      Parameters:
      row - The row where the ship is hit (int).
      column - The column where the ship is hit (int).
      Returns:
      true if a section of the ship occupies the given row and column, and the ship has not been sunk; otherwise, false.

    • isSunk

      public boolean isSunk()
      Return true if all parts of the ship have been hit; otherwise, false.
      Returns:
      true if all parts of the ship have been hit, otherwise, false.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a single character String for use in the Ocean's print method..
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      return 'X' if this ship has been sunk, and 'S' otherwise.
